resources.string: The app checks if your device is shaking more than usual by comparing the accelerometer readings to the standard deviation. A signal is then uploaded to the cloud, where it is compared with data from other users and a decision can be made about an earthquake. If an earthquake is detected, a push notification will be sent out and the earthquake will appear on the map.
For ShakeSafe to work properly, please leave the app open in the background. The phone will only upload data when the screen is off, laying on a flat surface, and charging.
The map below displays earthquakes around the world with magnitudes greater than 4.5, that were reported within the last day. This data was extracted from USGS.
Location permissions are required to know where vibrations are uploaded from, to effectively find an epicenter.
To distinguish uploads between this device and others, a unique ID will be used and stored locally in memory. The app will automatically assign this device an ID.
